abstract.t: Many user applications and the transport protocols that make them possible require two-way communications. To address this need, and also for system simplicity, round-trip loss measurements are frequently conducted in practice. The Two-Way Active Measurement Protocol specified in RFC 5357 establishes a round-trip loss measurement capability for the Internet. However, there is currently no metric specified according to the RFC 2330 framework. This memo proposes/adds round-trip loss to the set of IP Performance Metrics (IPPM).
